title: How many US slaves were beaten to death, or simply killed? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Slaves were treated very harshly. Many were beaten for punishment. It’s hard to tell how often they were beaten to death. Many probably died from injuries of a severe beating. But, remember they were purchased property. A slave owner beating a slave to death was destroying his own property. It would be like beating your horse to death. For committing crimes though the slave could be hanged in public.

The truth is, no one knows. Slaves were considered property, not people. There were no real penalties attached to slave abuse, so most instances went unreported and unrecorded. This is only one of the reasons that slavery has left an indelible stain on the history of this nation. We are still dealing with the after effects to this day.
